title: Shareholder Meeting
description: Michael speaks out of line at the Dunder Mifflin shareholders meeting and creates a big problem for management, while Jim discovers that nobody in the office thinks he's the "real" boss.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: [Dwight enters dressed as Recyclops] Not again.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Bow down before Recyclops.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Five years ago, corporate said we had to start a recycling program for Earth Day so Dwight took the lead on that and introduced us to a very close friend of his named Recyclops.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Happy Earth Day, everyone. I'm Recyclops. Did you know that an old milk carton can be sawed in half and used as a planter?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: The next year he really stepped things up.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Who has put a number seven plastic in a number four bin?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: A year after that Recylcops really began to take shape.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Recylops will drown you in your over-watered lawns.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Then tragedy struck Recyclops when his fictional planet was attacked by some other fictitious thing... I can't remember.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Recyclops will have his revenge.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I think this was also the year he renounced Earth Day and vowed to the destroy the planet he once loved.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh my God, you guys, look. It's Recyclops.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Recyclops destroys! [starts tearing through the office]

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Oh, is today Recyclops Day?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I thought you were killed by Polluticorn.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Polluticorn wishes. [starts spraying the office with something]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: That's aerosol spray. It's terrible for the environment.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Humans are terrible for the environment.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: The thing I like most about Recyclops is that he's creating a different world for our child.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Mmm.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: A world where you truly can be anything you want.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: God bless you, Recyclops. And your cold robot heart. [Dwight throws an aluminum can towards the recycling bin and misses]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [seated] Ok. Ok. How 'bout this? [rises, waves, sits back down]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: That's great.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I want it to be better than 'Great', Pam. How 'bout I remain seated... and I just do a little bit of a nod. Sort of a humble thing. [demonstrates]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Sure.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Nope. Then my face is down. They can't see my face.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: And it looks like you're taking a dump.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Alan Brand is the CEO of the company, if title's important to you, has personally invited moi to go to New York to the shareholder's meeting  and sit up on the stage with the board of directors. And at some point they are going to introduce me as the most successful branch manager that they have. And then Michael Scott turns and waves to the crowd... and the crowd goes wild.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [doing an announcer voice] Ladies and gentlemen from Scranton, Pennsylvania, please welcome Michael 'The Machine' Scott. [Michael waves, twirls and sits down]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Don't do the twirl.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Lose the twirl.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: The twirl sucks.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Michael, I hated the twirl.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [still doing the voice & spinning in his chair] Hate the twirl!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ok. Obviously I'm not going to do the twirl. I only did it because I nailed the wave.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Yeah, good. Don't do it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I am not going to do the twirl. Alright? It's not even a twirl, it's a spin. I might do the spin.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: The long term problem is bad investments that they need to dump. The short term problem is the company has no cash and there's no where to get it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ok, Oscar, I don't need the whole enchilada just the bullet points.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Those are the bullet points.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, could you condense it please?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: That's as simple as I can make it.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Michael? The limo's here for you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It's not a limo. It's a town car. Town cars are actually better, though. Better torque. Better handling.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: He said limousine, so...

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [at window in conference room] Check it out, guys. There's a limo down here. [everyone heads to the conference room] Michael, look. Oh, man.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: They sent a limo.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Town cars suck. Town car is something that a company sends when they're in trouble. A limousine is something that a company sends when they have cause for celebration. And in this case I think we are celebrating me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [everyone is rushing down the stairs to see the limo] Oh, wait. Wait. Wow. Wow! Oh, no way. Look at that.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What kind of mileage does this baby get?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: It's like what high school kids take to prom on tv shows.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: This is so typical of management to spend money on this. Ugh. Bunch of boobs.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hate to break it to you Oscar but some of us like boobs.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Calves. Calves all the way.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I'm so jealous right now.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, you know who you should be jealous of? Yourself. Because you're invited and you're invited and you're invited and you and you and you and you and you and you-

quotes.speaker: Limo Driver
quotes.text: Car seats eight.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Limo Driver
quotes.text: The car seats eight.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: The limo seats eight. Ok. Then Jim and Pam and Ryan plus a guest.

quotes.speaker: {jim} & {pam}
quotes.text: No thanks.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I'll use it when you're done.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [others  start raising their hands to be picked] Mmm... whoa.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: The Dunder Mifflin stock symbol is DMI. Do you know what that stands for? Dummies, morons and idiots. Because that's what you'd  have to be to own it. And, as one of those idiots, I believe the board owes me answers.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [in the limo with Dwight, Andy and Oscar] I wish the windows weren't tinted so people could see us in here.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hey, guys, do you think anyone might have had sex in here?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Definitely.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Smells like it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Definitely. Look they got pillows. That. That's bigger than my bed.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Word.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah! Yeah! Yeah!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [the limo driver raises the divider window] Who's playing with the button?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey, Ryan. Could you start consolidating all our Rolodex information into Outlook?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Uh, it doesn't seem like there's much of a point if the company's going under.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: But if the company doesn't go under then we'll finally have all our contacts in one program.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: The company's probably going under, though.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Could go either way.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Seems like it's leaning one way.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Maybe we should just wait and find out.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Definitely.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ok.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: So should we wait to find out before we start doing all this stuff?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Nah. Might as well do it now.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Michael, what if somebody asks you a question at this meeting? Are you just gonna wave, or what?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I will have to answer.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'll ask you a question.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Make it a softball. Something he can, like, crank out of the park.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Michael Scott you run the most profitable branch of Dunder Mifflin. How do you do it?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no. That's too hard. Say your name is Zamboni and then I will say, 'Well, we're sort of on thin ice.' [they all laugh] I won't say that. I'll something like that.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: This is your big day. Come on.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, my god. This is it.

quotes.speaker: Laurie
quotes.text: Mr. Scott?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Laurie
quotes.text: I'm Laurie.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, hi.

quotes.speaker: Laurie
quotes.text: Thank you for joining us. Come with me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, thank you and, and please call - continue to call me Mr. Scott.

quotes.speaker: Laurie
quotes.text: Ok. If you just want to follow me I'll take you up to the lounge.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, I guess this is as far as I can take you guys. So -

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Kay.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Good luck, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: See you later.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [walking past bodyguards at the door] Officers. Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Laurie
quotes.text: After you, Mr. Scott.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hello.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: So glad you could make it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: How was the ride?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh. It was awesome. Very, very sublime.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: I'm glad. I want to introduce you to everyone. First we'll start with Alan Brand. Alan? CEO. Michael Scott, Branch manager, Scranton.

quotes.speaker: Alan
quotes.text: It's nice to meet you, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It's nice to meet you, too. It's an honor and a privilege.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Seated, we have the former congressman, Chris O'Keefe.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ah. [bows] Your eminence.

quotes.speaker: Registrar
quotes.text: For those of you with questions, please line up behind one of the four microphones that have been placed in the aisles.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Coming through. Che, che, che, che, che, che. [spots microphone and gets in line, sees an empty mic and attempts to get there first] Excuse me. Excuse me. Excuse me. Excuse me. [a line appears from nowhere] Ah. Damn it. [ heads back to the original line which is now even longer] Wha- okay [grunts]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I was hoping to lob Michael his softball question early. I wanted to swing by the garment district, pick up a few crates of my shirts. I got a shirt guy.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Can you believe this? The money they spent on this convention hall. [finding a seat] Excuse me, miss. I just want to take the stupid board of directors by their necks. This is so simple.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah. Well, you should do that. Get in line.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Oh, what a great idea and lose my job. No thank you.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Look, do you want to be able to tell your grandkids you stood up for yourself during the - America's biggest financial crisis?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: How is he gonna have grandkids?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You guys ever protect the president?

quotes.speaker: Bodyguard
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What about Madonna? Or Obama twins? Anybody famous?

quotes.speaker: Bodyguard
quotes.text: Not supposed to talk about it. Nelly Furtado.

quotes.speaker: Alan
quotes.text: Alright, guys. You ready?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Rock and roll. [they walk into convention room and are booed by everyone]

quotes.speaker: Alan
quotes.text: Dunder Mifflin is still a strong company. We are poised to come through this more streamlined and profitable than ever. [boos from the crowd]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [to David] This is not as much fun as I thought it would be.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: It was fun when we weren't on the brink of bankruptcy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [accidentally into his microphone] We're going bankrupt, you think? [angry jeering from the crowd] They are really angry.

quotes.speaker: Alan
quotes.text: The shareholders need to empower our leadership -

quotes.speaker: Woman In Line
quotes.text: I'm just gonna run to the bathroom. Will you save my place?

quotes.speaker: Man in line
quotes.text: Sure.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No. You will not.

quotes.speaker: Woman In Line
quotes.text: Excuse me?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, I'm sorry. Were you raised in a household with no consequences?

quotes.speaker: Woman In Line
quotes.text: It'll just be a second.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh. If onlys and justs were candies and nuts then every day would be Erntedankfest.

quotes.speaker: Alan
quotes.text: ... and we're confident. There are many things to be optimistic about in Dunder Mifflin's future and one of them is here with us today. Michael Scott, Scranton Branch manager.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [loudly applauds] Yes.

quotes.speaker: Alan
quotes.text: In these uncertain times, Michael has managed to maintain steady profits from his Scranton branch. We all thank you, Michael. [scattered applause] Another bright spot in the Dunder Mifflin landscape, our new waste pulp re-purposing plant in Milford. [applause]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey, Phyllis. Are you just getting back from lunch now?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Bob took me to Capello's. We got a little tipsy.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ok. You shouldn't be telling me that stuff and also shouldn't be taking two hour lunches without telling me.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Oh, it's ok. Michael doesn't really care about these things.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I care about them and I'm just as much of a boss as Michael. [Stanley laughs] What's so funny? I'm a co-manager.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: That doesn't make you a boss.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: It's not like you can fire people or anything.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well - who? How did you? Who, who told you this?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Ryan.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Can't say.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Sorry. Plastered.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ok. Who else has heard the rumor that I am not as much in charge as Michael? [everyone raises there hands - including Pam]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Stuff gets around. I don't participate.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Who here heard it from Ryan?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Does an email count?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yeah. [everyone raises hands again]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I am just as much of a boss as Michael and I can do anything that Michael can do. Alright?  Who here believes that I have as much power as Michael? [Pam, after a moment,  is the only one who raises her hand]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I forgot I have to support him no matter what. Close one.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: These questions are bush league.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You should get up and say something. You've got to be true to what's in there. [points to Oscar's heart] Don't be a wuss.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I've always been the guy who can rally other people to rebel. In high school I organized a walk out over standardized testing. Got over 500 students to just skip the SATs. At the last second I chickened out, took it anyway, got a 1220, always regretted it. I feel lachrymose .

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: [over the crowd booing] Believe me everyone is working very hard, working weekends, struggling, trying to right the ship.

quotes.speaker: Shareholder
quotes.text: You're a criminal.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, hey, hey. I'm sorry. These are not criminals. They are nice. They invited me to come here today. They invited me to their hospitality suite where I  had free food and it was delicious. Get this. Know how nice they are? The sent a stretch limo all the way to pick me up in Scranton. That's -

quotes.speaker: Female Shareholder
quotes.text: Limousine?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Second Shareholder
quotes.text: You're all corrupt. You should be in jail. [crowd agrees]

quotes.speaker: Alan
quotes.text: Quiet! Quiet, please! Please, quiet! Quiet, please. We want to hear your questions.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Do you love her or do you love the idea of her?

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: I don't know, man. I just don't know.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I gotta make an example out of him. Should I just fire him?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Can you actually fire people?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: To be honest, I don't know, but maybe I could just yell at him in front of people.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Well, I can't really imagine you yelling at anyone.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, well I yell. You've heard me yell.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh. Ok. I've heard you exclaim. Like the time you said, 'Hey, look. We parked over here!'.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, that was apple-picking day and there's no need to yell that day, you know. I was just excited to find the car. Perfect end to a perfect day.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Well, you'll figure it out.

quotes.speaker: Alan
quotes.text: Ok. We're gonna take a 15 minute break and then we're gonna answer more questions.

quotes.speaker: Third Shareholder
quotes.text: You haven't said anything yet and we're headed for bankruptcy. [crowd agrees]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [board of directors has started to exit] Yeah, well, that's not gonna happen. That's not gonna happen. We'll be back with some answers. [a few murmurs from the crowd of 'What answers?'] I - ok. I know that you're mad at me and you're mad at all them -

quotes.speaker: Fourth Shareholder
quotes.text: How are you gonna fix the company?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ok. Alright. We are gonna - we're gonna go out there during this break and we are gonna come back with a plan. We're gonna come back with a plan for you. It's a 45 day plan. 45 days to get us back on track. [crowd starts to agree and perk up] 45 points. It's a 45 day/45 point. One point per day. We get the 45 points we are back in business. [crowd applauds] And you can take that to the bank. [applause continue] And Limo Lady, we are going completely carbon neutral. [crowd has gotten very excited and is cheering] I love you, New York! [Michael does the spin and leaves the stage - then runs back across the stage] You. You.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey, Ryan. How's it going?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: [playing Tetris on his computer] Here's the thing. Um, I've tried it like five different ways in my head and - Oh, got one. Um, I'm such a perfectionist...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Mmm-hmm.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: That I'd kinda rather not do it all then do a crappy version.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Simple data entry, though. So there's really only one way to do it.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Sounds like you have a really specific vision for it. Do you wanna maybe just take a whack at it?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You know what?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I think I know the problem.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Great.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I think you seem distracted.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Yep, that is a problem.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: But, you know what? I came up with something and I think it's really gonna help.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Well, I'm glad you're finally being proactive, Jim.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I am, too. Let me show you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Wow. Things are really picking up.

quotes.speaker: O'Keefe
quotes.text: What was that about?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Alan
quotes.text: You were supposed to wave.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I did wave. I did a lot more than wave.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: What are we supposed to tell them now? Ok? You've dug us quite a hole.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We tell them the plan, right?

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: There is no plan.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Here's what we're gonna do. The 45 day thing that I outlined, we go with that. Day 45, company saved. Day 44, go. What do we got? We have 15 minutes.

quotes.speaker: O'Keefe
quotes.text: Excuse me?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Just whatever comes to mind. Shout it out.

quotes.speaker: O'Keefe
quotes.text: Who the hell is this guy?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I am the guy who roused that crowd.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Got them on their feet.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: They were so happy down there.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Alan
quotes.text: Who cares?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ok. Alright. Well, I know a guy. This Mexican guy. He is a math whiz. He knows economics as well as he knows bull fighting and I am going to call in a little favor.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: No. No. No. No. No. No. Don't call anybody, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, I'm texting him, so.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Please do not text anybody, now, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It's done. [Oscar, sitting in the lobby, receives a text]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh. There he is. Come on in. Come on in. Gentleman, I would like you to meet Oscar. Come on in. Don't be shy. This is Oscar Martinez. Oscar, why don't you come over here. Let me present you. Step up. Step up there. Oscar is an accountant extraordinaire at the Scranton branch and he has a wonderful idea as to how to get us out of this murky, murky situation. Take it away. [Oscar stands there stunned]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I think this is really gonna help. If you could just hold up here one second. [addresses the whole office] Hey, guys. Quick announcement. If I could just have everyone's attention. [turns back to Ryan] I just figured you needed a place where you can concentrate and not be bothered by bothering people.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Mmm-hmm.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Let me show you what I mean. [Jim opens the closet door to reveal a work station] Your new office. How great is that, right? For a job well done. Well, not done.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I will, uh, I will do my work right now. I will stay late tonight.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Right.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Uh, I'm very sorry... about everything.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [laughs] You're a good kid. You know what? It gets bigger once you're in there. Enjoy it. [shuts the door and walks to his office]

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: [from behind the door] Is there internet?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Ummm...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Tell them what you told me. This is genius.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Ok

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Tell them about the cash flow and the dumping of properties and - this is all -

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Um..

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It's all good. It's all good stuff. Lay it on them.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I feel, as does Mr. Scott, that we are in the best of hands. Capable hands.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That wasn't what you were saying to me. He was much more articulate and that was better. Much better.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I think this has gone very well and I thank you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: O-kay. Oh... hey, hey. [follows Oscar into the hall] What are you doing?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Michael, I didn't ask to come up here.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Wow, man. That -

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That was embarrassing.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: For me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: For me, too. You embarrassed me.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: You -[Oscar walks away, Michael goes back in the room]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, that was a waste of a text. Let's get down to brass tacks. I think that we might be in trouble. We don't seem to have a plan so I'm thinking I go down there. Maybe rattle off a few jokes. Congressman could follow.

quotes.speaker: O'Keefe
quotes.text: He's our best manager? Where's the off button on this moron?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh, I'm not a moron. Time after time my branch leads in sales. I have personally won over 17 Dundie awards. So, I am not a moron and I am just trying to help, you know? So... you're the moron.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [zipping through the hall while texting]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes it is a thrill to be honored by one's company. To have the people that you work for stop for a minute and say, 'Wow. Great job.'  That is what it is all about. Not the perks. Perks? The perks. I could take or leave the perks.  Limos are for people who make the company money not lose millions and have no plan. So we're leaving early. After all, we are the only ones with anything to celebrate.

quotes.speaker: O'Keefe
quotes.text: He can take the bus. He's had his limo ride.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [running out of the building with Oscar, Andy, and Dwight] Oscar! Oscar! Come on!  There he is! There he is! Go! Go! Go! Go! Go! Go! Go!  Scranton! Scranton! Scranton! Dunder Mifflin!

quotes.speaker: Alan
quotes.text: The gentleman in the, uh, glasses.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Dwight Schrute, Scranton branch. I just want to say that I have been standing in this line all day and if this line is any indication of how this company is being run then we are in big trouble. [cheers from crowd] Thank you. Right. I know. And I just want to say that I believe that there are options out there. [crowd still applauding] A take a number option like they have in a deli. What about line varieties? Like an express line for quick comments of ten words or less. They can move much more efficiently. What about ropes along the lines that you can hold on to.

quotes.speaker: Alan
quotes.text: Thank you. Thank you for your suggestions.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah.
